revisions.rev:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''EastEnders'' characters (2004)}} The following is a list of characters that first appeared in the [[BBC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[EastEnders]]'' in 2004, by order of first appearance. {{TOClimit|limit=2}} == Keith Makepeace == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Keith Makepeace |portrayer=[[Julian Parkin]] |years=2004 |appeared=13 January 2004 |home=Trading Standards inspector }} '''Keith Makepeace''' was a [[Trading Standards]] inspector who visited [[Walford#Bridge Street|Bridge Street]] market on 13 January 2004. [[Martin Fowler (EastEnders)|Martin Fowler]] was worried that the weights on his stall were not accurate, so [[Sonia Fowler|Sonia Jackson]] helped him to fix them, and he passed the inspection."[http://www.walford.net/update/20040113.htm TUE 13-JAN-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 5 June 2006"[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1623 Keith Makepeace]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 {{-}} == Michael Nee == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Michael Nee |portrayer=[[Christopher Fry (actor)|Christopher Fry]] |years=2004 |appeared=3 February 2004 |home=Trainee taxi driver |wife=Val Nee }} '''Michael Nee''' was a young trainee taxi driver who expressed interest in buying [[Charlie Slater]]'s taxi from him, as he was due to sit his taxi driver exams the following week. As his wife, Val, was pregnant,"[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1675 Michael Nee]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 Charlie let him have the taxi for [[pounds sterling|Â£]]700 instead of the advertised Â£1000, because he reminded Charlie of himself."[http://www.walford.net/update/20040203.htm TUE 03-FEB-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 4 June 2006 {{-}} == Dom Shaw == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Dom Shaw |portrayer=[[Lloyd McGuire]] |years=2004 |first=9 February 2004 |last=12 February 2004 |home=Publican }} '''Dom Shaw''' was a board member on the [[Walford]] Community Centre committee. When [[Sharon Rickman|Sharon Watts]] wanted to hold a [[Valentine's Day]] ball in the Community Centre in 2004, she needed to get a liquor license, but Community Centre manager [[Derek Harkinson]] was unable to obtain one due to a previous criminal conviction for growing [[cannabis]]."[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1685 Dom Shaw]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007"[http://www.walford.net/update/20040209.htm MON 09-FEB-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007 When Shaw discovered Derek's conviction, he sacked him, but was persuaded to reinstate Derek by [[Martin Fowler (EastEnders)|Martin Fowler]]."[http://www.walford.net/update/20040210.htm TUE 10-FEB-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007 He later obtained a license for the Community Centre, as he owned a pub."[http://www.walford.net/update/20040212.htm THU 12-FEB-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007 {{-}} == Jill Green == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Jill Green |portrayer=[[Elizabeth Rider]] |years=2004, 2007â08 |first=17 February 2004 |last= 8 May 2008 |home=Nurse }} '''Jill Green''' is a [[nurse]] at Walford General Hospital. She first appeared when [[Ronny Ferreira]] had a kidney transplant, then later appeared in January 2007 when [[Deano Wicks]] and [[Chelsea Fox]] were in a car crash, and in May 2008, when [[Roxy Slater|Roxy Mitchell]] ran [[Pat Evans]] over. {{-}} == JJ == {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |image= |name=JJ |portrayer=[[Daniel Anthony (actor)|Daniel Anthony]] |years=2004 |introducer = [[Louise Berridge]] |first = 19 February 2004 |last = 23 February 2004 |classification = Former; Guest }} '''JJ''', played by [[Daniel Anthony (actor)|Daniel Anthony]], is a teenage runaway who breaks into the Abercorn Bed & Breakfast, disturbing the proprietor [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) and his fiancÃ©e, [[Yolande Duke]] ([[Angela Wynter]]). When confronted, JJ tells the couple that he is 16 and is living on the streets, so they soften, letting him stay when he offers to help out around the place. Patrick's stepson [[Paul Trueman]] ([[Gary Beadle]]) takes a dislike to JJ and is suspicious of him. When Yolande offers to wash JJ's jacket, he acts evasive and it is revealed he stole some jewellery from her. Paul informs JJ's social worker, [[#Mattie George|Mattie George]] (Chizzy Akudolu), who arrives to collect JJ and reveals he is only 14 and has run away from care. Patrick and Yolande are furious with Paul and later visit JJ in care and learn that his mother is in prison and they later decide to foster. {{-}} == George Wakefield == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=George Wakefield |portrayer=[[Andrew Bridgemont]] |years=2004 |appeared=23 February 2004 |occupation=Counsellor }} '''George Wakefield''' was a [[Licensed Professional Counselor|counsellor]] at Walford General Hospital who spoke to [[Tariq Larousi]] before one of his [[kidney]]s was removed for his half brother [[Ronny Ferreira]]'s [[kidney transplant]] operation."[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1705 George Wakefield]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007 "[http://www.walford.net/update/20040223.htm MON 23-FEB-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 6 June 2007 {{-}} == Mattie George == {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |image= |name=Mattie George |portrayer=[[Chizzy Akudolu]] |years=2004 |appeared=23 February 2004 |occupation=Social worker }} '''Mattie George''' was a [[social worker]] who collected [[#JJ|JJ]], a teen runaway, from the bed and breakfast run by [[Patrick Trueman|Patrick]] and [[Yolande Trueman]]. She took him back to the care home where he lived, after [[Paul Trueman]] reported to Social Services that he was there."[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1704 Mattie George]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 {{-}} ==Wilfred Atkins== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Wilfred Atkins |portrayer= [[Dudley Sutton]] |years=2004 |first=4 March 2004 |last=3 June 2004 |occupation=Conman }} '''Wilfred Atkins''' was [[Nana Moon]]'s fiancÃ©e, who she met on the bus to her holiday in [[Eastbourne]]. She brought him back to [[Walford]] in March 2004 to meet her grandsons [[Alfie Moon|Alfie]] and [[Spencer Moon|Spencer]]. Alfie was cautious of Wilfred at first, thinking he was only interested in Nana's money, but Wilfred told Alfie that he was rich and had fallen in love with Nana. Alfie's partner [[Kat Moon|Kat]] later agreed that Wilfred could move into [[The Queen Victoria|The Queen Vic]] when he and Nana were married. Alfie was later enraged that Wilfred had not booked a [[honeymoon]], and marched him to the travel agent's to book one. Wilfred later admired the war medals of Nana's late husband William, then surprised Nana with the news that he had booked a honeymoon in the [[West Indies]]. Alfie welcomed him into the family. On his wedding day, Wilfred got nervous and tried to run away, only to be caught by Alfie at [[Walford East]] station. He confided in Alfie that he was ill, and didn't want Nana to become his nurse. Alfie agreed to let Wilfred leave, but when he went to hug Wilfred he felt a sharp pain, and opened Wilfred's jacket to reveal William's medals. Wilfred was exposed as a con artist. Alfie didn't want to have to break the news to his grandmother, so he dragged Wilfred back to the pub, where he confessed to stealing the medals. Nana revealed that she knew all along. Nana forgave Wilfred, but he fled Walford along with [[pound sterling|Â£]]30,000 that he had conned out of [[Pat Evans]]. {{-}} == Simon Gott == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Simon Gott |portrayer=[[Johann Myers]] |years=2004 |appeared=22 April 2004 |occupation=Nurse }} '''Simon Gott''' was the nurse who cared for [[Mark Fowler]] in the days leading up to his death from [[AIDS]]-related illness, and informed Mark's brother [[Martin Fowler (EastEnders)|Martin]] of Mark's death over the telephone on 12 April 2004. He appeared at Mark's funeral, and gave Martin a letter written by Mark giving him advice on how to live his life."[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1796 Simon Gott]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007"[http://walford.net/update/20040422.htm THU 22-APR-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 {{-}} ==Chrissie Watts== {{Main|Chrissie Watts}} == Robert MacLean == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Robert MacLean |portrayer=[[Gordon Kane]] |years=2004 |appeared=29 April 2004 |occupation=Fire safety officer }} '''Robert MacLean''' was a fire safety officer who inspected [[R&R (EastEnders)|Angie's Den]] following a fire there."[http://www.walfordweb.co.uk/walfordweb/whoswho-show.php?id=1800 Robert MacLean]", ''Walford Web'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 According to [[Den Watts]] he was a "jobsworth", but the inspection went well and MacLean approved the reopening of the club."[http://www.walford.net/update/20040429.htm THU 29-APR-04]", ''walford.net'', URL last accessed 5 June 2007 {{-}} ==Jane Beale== {{Main|Jane Beale}} == David Collins == {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=David Collins |portrayer=[[Dan Milne]] |years=2004 |first=19 August 2004 |last=31 December 2004 |death=31 December 2004 |wife=[[Jane Beale|Jane Clarke]] (1992â2004) }} '''David Collins''' was the husband of [[Jane Beale|Jane Collins]] who suffered from [[Huntington's disease]] and lived in a hospice."[http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/episodes/past/episode20040819.shtml#4 Ian tries to charm Jane]", ''bbc.co.uk/eastenders'', URL last accessed 26 May 2007 Jane kept David a secret from her new boss [[Ian Beale|Ian]], but one day Ian demanded to know why she was infrequent with her work, and Jane took him to meet David. Ian regularly visited him until David died on [[New Year's Eve]] 2004, leaving Jane heartbroken, as she had slept with Ian prior to his death. In January 2008, it was revealed that Jane's brother [[Christian Clarke]] had been in love with David. {{-}} ==Sarah Cairns== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Sarah Cairns |portrayer=[[Alison Pargeter]] |years=2004 |first=3 September 2004 |last=22 October 2004 |born= |occupation= Barmaid |family= }} '''Sarah Cairns''' was a barmaid in Angie's Den club. She first appeared when [[Martin Fowler (EastEnders)|Martin Fowler]] and his friends pretended to have a [[stag party]] in order to get some free drinks. Martin got very drunk and was seen chatting up Sarah. The following morning, Martin woke up in Sarah's bed. Martin admitted to Sarah that he had made a mistake as he was married, and Sarah seemed to back off. However, it soon emerged that Sarah was [[mental illness|mentally unstable]] and began to [[stalking|stalk]] Martin as well as send him [[text message]]s declaring her love for him. Sarah eventually ran in front of a car knowing that Martin's wife [[Sonia Fowler|Sonia]] would see. Sonia was a nurse, so she looked after Sarah and they became good friends. Meanwhile, Sarah had convinced herself that Martin loved her and that he would leave Sonia to be with her. Martin kept the truth about Sarah from Sonia but Sarah had told Martin's family she was dating a "certain" married man, and later confessed to [[Pauline Fowler|Pauline]] that it was Martin. Martin began to crack under pressure and went to the police, but they didn't believe him. While he was out, Pauline "fell" off a stepladder, and Sarah had disappeared. Martin tracked her down and threatened her until she confessed that she had pushed Pauline. He told Sarah he would kill her if she showed her face again. Sarah called the police and Martin spent most of the day in the police station. During this time Sarah went to the Fowlers and told Sonia of Martin's deceit. When Martin arrived, he apologised to Sonia and promised it meant nothing and would never happen again. When Sonia forgave him, Sarah refused to leave, still adamant that she and Martin were meant to be. She insisted he was different from any others. She finally admitted that although Martin fell asleep in her bed, they hadn't actually had sex. Sarah realised she could never be with Martin so she stabbed Martin in his stomach with a pen knife. During the fight, Sonia picked up a fruit bowl, bashed Sarah on the head, and then called an ambulance for Martin. Sarah fell unconscious and was later committed to a mental institution. [[Radio Times]] included Sarah in their feature profiling 'bunny boilers' and of her duration they stated: "If she's not a regular on her way to being written out, she's a guest who appears, causes havoc, and then vanishes again. [...] Sarah was one such, a barmaid in E20 who stalked, harassed and finally stabbed Martin Fowler when he refused to dump Sonia. Last heard of in an institution."{{cite web|last=McLean|first=Gareth|title=Soapland's top bunny-boilers|url=http://www.radiotimes.com/blogs/810-soaps-bunny-boilers/|work=[[Radio Times]]|publisher=([[BBC Magazines]])|accessdate=2011-01-01|date=29 November 2009}} {{-}} ==Keith Miller== {{Main|Keith Miller (EastEnders)}} ==Demi Miller== {{Main|Demi Miller}} ==Darren Miller== {{Main|Darren Miller}} ==Clint== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Clint |portrayer=[[Huggy Leaver]] |years=2004â06 |first=6 September 2004 |last=7 July 2006 |sisters=[[Rosie Miller]] |nephews=[[Mickey Miller]]
[[Darren Miller]] |nieces=[[Dawn Swann]]
[[Demi Miller]] }} '''Clint''' (real name '''Beverly''') was a [[recurring character|recurring]] [[fictional character]] from the [[BBC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[EastEnders]]'', played by [[Huggy Leaver]]. He appeared from 2004 to 2006 as [[Rosie Miller]]'s brother. Clint first arrived in his old [[ice cream]] van, loaded with all the Millers' possessions. The ice cream van bears the somewhat dubious logo of Clint's Creamy Whip. He came to [[Walford]] to help out his family whenever they needed him. He was also seen when [[Mike Swann]], Rosie's ex-husband, was staying with the Millers and [[Keith Miller (EastEnders)|Keith]] needed some support. His last appearance was when he helped Rosie to move back out of the Square. Clint's ice cream van however made a reappearance around August bank holiday 2007. Clint was on holiday so Mickey and Keith were left to mind the van. They used the van to sell ice creams to fund a DIY project of painting [[List of EastEnders characters (2007)#Summer Swann|Summer Swann]]'s nursery. Eventually, Clint gives the van to his nephew [[Darren Miller|Darren]]. {{-}} ==Rosie Miller== {{Main|Rosie Miller}} ==Tommy Grant== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Tommy Grant |portrayer=[[Robert Cavanah]] |years=2004 |first=14 September 2004 |last=22 November 2004 |home=[[Thailand]] }} '''Tommy Grant''' was the much older boyfriend of [[Vicki Fowler]] who took a shine to Vicki's stepmother [[Chrissie Watts]]. They kissed and Tommy arranged for them to meet in the toilets in [[the Queen Vic]]. He stripped [[nudity|naked]] and Chrissie stole his clothes, exposing him (as a cheat, and literally exposing him!). He then ran away through the market, naked. The next day, as he got into a taxi to the airport, [[Den Watts|Den]] got into the taxi with him and took him to [[R&R (EastEnders)|Angie's Den]] where he pinned him down and warned him to stay away from his family. Tommy tormented Den by telling him how he enjoyed kissing Chrissie. Den told Tommy to leave [[Walford]] and never return. Tommy now lives in [[Thailand]]. {{-}} ==Matt Hill== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Matt Hill |portrayer=[[Ben Joiner]] |years=2004 |appeared=30 September 2004 |occupation=Events promoter }} '''Matthew "Matt" Hill''' was an events promoter who [[Kat Moon]] met in a nightclub called U4ia, shortly before leaving her husband [[Alfie Moon|Alfie]] and moving away from [[Walford]]. After she left, Matt arrived at [[The Queen Victoria|The Queen Vic]] looking for Kat, as she had arranged to meet him there. Alfie was agitated by this, and got progressively angry with Matt, until he physically threw Matt out of the pub. {{-}} ==Ray Taylor== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Ray Taylor |portrayer=[[Dorian Lough]] |years=2004â05 |first=29 October 2004 |last=12 August 2005 |home = Walford Towers |wife=[[Trisha Taylor]] |sons=[[Leo Taylor (EastEnders)|Leo Taylor]] |granddaughters=[[List of EastEnders characters (2004)#Aleesha Miller|Aleesha Miller]] }} '''Ray Taylor''' was the abusive husband of [[List of EastEnders characters (2005)#Trisha Taylor|Trisha Taylor]] and father of [[Leo Taylor (EastEnders)|Leo]]. He hated [[Keith Miller (EastEnders)|Keith Miller]] from a business deal-gone-wrong, and made Leo and [[Demi Miller|Demi's]] love hard. He was last seen at the hospital when Leo died from a drugs overdose. {{-}} ==Aleesha Miller== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Aleesha Miller |portrayer=Freya Coltman-West
Phoebe Coltman-West |years=2004â06 |born=28 October 2004 |first=29 October 2004 |last=7 July 2006 |home=[[Cotswolds|The Cotswolds]] |occupation= |father=[[#Leo Taylor|Leo Taylor]] |mother=[[Demi Miller]] |grandfathers=[[Ray Taylor (EastEnders)|Ray Taylor]]
[[Keith Miller (EastEnders)|Keith Miller]] |grandmothers=[[Trisha Taylor]]
[[Rosie Miller]] |aunts=[[Dawn Swann]] |uncles=[[Mickey Miller]]
[[Darren Miller]] |cousins=[[Summer Swann]]
[[ George Trott]] }} '''Aleesha BeyoncÃ© Miller''' was born on the show on 29 October 2004, and was played by [[twins]] Freya and Phoebe Coltman-West. Aleesha is the infant daughter of teenagers [[Demi Miller]] and [[#Leo Taylor|Leo Taylor]]. Aleesha's godparents are her uncle [[Mickey Miller|Mickey]] and (until her death in December 2006) neighbour [[Pauline Fowler]], whose heart softened towards the Millers since she accompanied Demi to hospital for Aleesha's birth. Aleesha was the centre of an ongoing feud between her maternal and paternal grandparents, with she and her parents bearing the brunt of the turmoil. Demi and Leo took her with them when they ran away together. They left her with her godmother Pauline when they had to move into a squat. This led to her father's death from a heroin overdose, when Demi took some heroin to numb her pain and Leo overdosed because he thought she was dead. Aleesha left Walford with [[Rosie Miller|Rosie]] and Demi on 7 July 2006 to live in the [[Cotswolds]]. {{-}} ==Leo Taylor== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Leo Taylor |portrayer=[[Philip Dowling]] |years=2004â05 |first= 29 October 2004 |last=12 August 2005 |born= |death=11 August 2005 |classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2005|Former; regular]] |father=[[Ray Taylor (EastEnders)|Ray Taylor]] |mother=[[Trisha Taylor]] |daughters=[[Aleesha Miller]] }} '''Leo Taylor''', played by [[Philip Dowling]], was [[Demi Miller]]'s boyfriend. He first appeared in October 2004 visiting his and Demi's new born baby daughter [[#Aleesha Miller|Aleesha]] In May 2005, the Millers returned to their former home in a block of flats whilst a rat problem in the square was being dealt with. Demi was reluctant, as it meant she was likely to bump into Leo. Upon their arrival, Leo's father Ray and his wife Trisha were the first people they saw, and they received a cold reception. Whilst taking Aleesha for a walk, Demi was teased by some of Darren's old friends, who mocked her and referred to her as "[[Vicky Pollard]]". Upon heading back to the flats, Demi saw Leo and tried to escape in a lift, but Leo stopped her. They realised their split had been due to their parents meddling and denying contact between the two, and they reunited. Demi told Leo that it was Aleesha's christening the following day. Despite appearing reluctant, Leo and Trisha did indeed attend the christening, however the service was interrupted by Ray, who viciously dragged his wife and son away whilst a heartbroken Demi looked on. The christening continued back at Clint's flat, and Demi and Leo met later that evening from their balconies. As the feud between the Millers and the Taylors escalated, Leo planned to run away, and begged Demi to come with him. Demi agreed, but Leo abandoned her when she insisted on taking Aleesha. Demi returned to Walford, devastated, but was delighted when she met Leo near the swings. Leo promised her he'd keep in touch, and would wait as long as it took to be together. Leo, Demi and Aleesha ran away, and Leo started dealing drugs. Demi took some of the drugs to numb her pain and she passed out. Leo returned to her and thought she was dead, so took a heroin overdose and died in hospital. This ending is a modern interpretation of that of [[Romeo and Juliet]] as much of the related storyline had been. {{-}} ==Stacey Slater== {{Main|Stacey Slater}} ==Freddie Mitchell== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Freddie Mitchell |portrayer=Alex Kilby
Tom Kilby |years=2004â06 |first=1 November 2004 |last=26 May 2006 |born= 2 September 2004{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/proginfo/tv/2010/wk7/feature_eastenders.shtml|title=EastEnders 25th anniversary feature â births, deaths and marriages|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=8 March 2010}} |home=[[Barnstaple]] |father=[[Graham Foster]] |mother=[[Little Mo Mitchell]] |grandfathers=[[Charlie Slater]] |grandmothers=[[#Barbara Foster|Barbara Foster]]
[[Viv Slater]] |aunts=[[Lynne Hobbs]]
[[Kat Moon]]
[[Belinda Peacock]] |cousins=[[Zoe Slater]]
[[Tommy Moon]] |relatives= }} '''Frederick William "Freddie" Mitchell''' (nÃ©e '''Slater''') was played by [[twin]]s Alex and Tom Kilby. Freddie was conceived in late 2003 when his mother, [[Little Mo Mitchell]], was [[rape]]d by her father's friend, [[List of EastEnders characters (2003)#Graham Foster|Graham Foster]]. Her refusal to [[abortion|abort]] the child caused the break-up of her marriage to [[Billy Mitchell (EastEnders)|Billy Mitchell]]. Mo went to stay with her sister, [[Belinda Peacock|Belinda]], where she gave birth to Freddie. In November 2004, after Graham was sentenced to eight years imprisonment, Little Mo and Billy made another attempt at their marriage, but they separated again after Billy admitted that he struggled to accept Freddie. Freddie then lived at the Slater household with Little Mo, his great-grandmother [[Mo Harris|Big Mo]], his grandfather [[Charlie Slater|Charlie]] and second cousin [[Stacey Slater|Stacey]]. In February and March 2006, Freddie caused his mother much stress by crying a lot. He took a trip to the park with his mother, [[Jane Beale|Jane Collins]] and [[Bobby Beale (EastEnders)|Bobby Beale]], where Bobby poked him in the forehead with a stick. Freddie had to go to hospital but was thankfully okay. However, the incident resulted in a visit from a health visitor. Mo thought that the health visitor was accusing her of abusing Freddie and became angry and hostile. Mo struggled to cope with her young son as when he was teething he often cried. In May 2006, Freddie went to hospital seriously ill with bleeding on the brain. A few days before the hospital admission, Mo had admitted to her boyfriend [[Oliver Cousins|Oliver]], who is also a GP, that she sometimes got very irritated with Freddie when he cried. When Oliver heard that Freddie's injury must have been caused by shaking or rough handling, he admitted what Mo had told him to a [[paediatrician]], [[List of EastEnders characters (2006)#Briony Campbell|Briony Campbell]], at the hospital. While the hospital believed that Mo may have shaken her son, Mo suspected that ten-year-old [[Ben Mitchell (EastEnders)|Ben Mitchell]] may have hurt him in some way as they were left unsupervised together just before the incident. Mo went to confront Ben and ended up shaking him in irritation when he tried to run away. After extensive tests at the hospital, it was discovered that Freddie had a temporary low [[platelet]] count, due to an infection, meaning that any minor injury could hurt him badly, as his blood wasn't clotting properly. Mo was no longer suspected of hurting her son. Freddie left [[Walford]] on 26 May 2006 with his mother who wanted to start a new life in [[Barnstaple]], [[Devon]]. {{-}} ==Barbara Foster== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=Barbara Foster |portrayer=[[Patricia Brake]] |years=2004 |first=2 November 2004 |last=5 November 2004 |sons=[[Graham Foster]] |grandsons=[[Freddie Mitchell (EastEnders)|Freddie Mitchell]] }} '''Barbara Foster''' is the mother of [[Graham Foster]], who attended his rape trial in November 2004. When it came time for Barbara to testify, Graham berated her for telling the court about his contact with his other children. Graham was then found guilty. [[Little Mo Mitchell]], Graham's victim and the mother of their child [[Freddie Mitchell (EastEnders)|Freddie]], felt sorry for Barbara and kept in contact with her until she and Freddie left Walford in May 2006. {{-}} ==Jean Slater== {{Main|Jean Slater}} ==DI Riddick== {{Infobox soap character 2 | series = EastEnders |image= |name=DI Riddick |portrayer=[[Roger Griffiths]] |years=2004â05 |first= 20 December 2004 |last = 8 November 2005 |occupation=[[Detective Inspector]] }} '''Detective Inspector Riddick''' was a local police officer. Riddick first appeared on the scene following [[Paul Trueman]]'s arrest for running drug errands for [[Andy Hunter (EastEnders)|Andy Hunter]]. Riddick urged Paul to stop protecting Andy and implicate him and Paul did so. When Paul was later murdered, Riddick and his colleague DS Jones questioned Andy, who had an alibi for where he had been at the time. Riddick's last appearance was when [[Chrissie Watts]] was arrested for the murder of her husband [[Den Watts|Den]]. {{-}} ==Jake Moon== {{Main|Jake Moon}} ==Danny Moon== {{Main|Danny Moon}} == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{EEcharlink|leo_t|Leo Taylor}} {{EastEnders}} {{EastEnders characters|year}} {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Eastenders Characters (2004)}} [[Category:Lists of EastEnders characters|2004]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 2004|*, EastEnders]]
